Class SeparatedListAdapter

java.lang.Object
  BaseAdapter
      org.t2health.lib.widget.SeparatedListAdapter

public class SeparatedListAdapter
extends BaseAdapter

A class to create sectioned lists.

Author:
robbiev
See Also:
http://jsharkey.org/blog/2008/08/18/separating-lists-with-headers-in-android-09/

SeparatedListAdapter

public SeparatedListAdapter(Context context,
                            int textViewLayout)
Initialize the adapter

Parameters:
context -
textViewLayout - The layout to use as the header. The layout file should be an instance of TextView widget. Otherwise you will have problems.
Method Detail

Add a section

Parameters:
section - The title of the section (as it would appear on the screen).
adapter - The adapter to add

getAdapterForItem

public Adapter getAdapterForItem(int position)
Returns the adapter of an item's position.

Parameters:
position - the position of the item. Keep in mind, the position includes the existance of the header row.
Returns:
The adapter for the item.

getItem

public java.lang.Object getItem(int position)
Get an item from the adapter as a whole. Keep in mind, the position includes the existence of the header row.

getCount

public int getCount()
Get the total number of items across all sections plus 1 for each header.

getViewTypeCount

public int getViewTypeCount()

getItemViewType

public int getItemViewType(int position)
Get the view type for the given position

Parameters:
position - The position of the item
Returns:
TYPE_SECTION_HEADER if the item is a header, -1 if it couldn't be determined..
